data.title: A Better State of Care
data.meta_description: ACN is an accountable care organization based in Phoenix, Arizona, that is leading the way to a better experience for patients and providers across the state.
data.text:
Our partners at Abrazo Health are hosting their annual West Valley Heart Walk on November 16th to support heart health initiatives. Join them at this exciting event to walk for a cause! Click the link in the post below for more details and to sign up today.👇Walk for a cause on Saturday, November 16, 2024! Register for the West Valley Heart Walk and help us support heart health initiatives. Every step matters! Click the link to sign up today! Click here (spr.ly/6185cj04h) to join a team or start your own. It's free. #AmericanHeartAssociation ... See MoreSee Less

⚖️ Obesity can have far-reaching effects on various parts of your body. Gilbert Center For Family Medicine shares the impact on your overall health in the post below.👇

If you need help managing your weight to protect your health, ACN's care coordination team can help you find an in-network provider.⚖️ Obesity can have far-reaching effects on various parts of your body.

It increases the risk of heart disease, diabetes, joint pain, and even certain cancers.

Your lungs, liver, kidneys, and digestive system can also be impacted.

Taking steps to manage your weight isn't just about appearance – it's about protecting your long-term health.

#ObesityAwareness #HealthyLiving ... See MoreSee Less

Our partners at Valleywise Health shared an important story from 71-year-old burn survivor Robert Woolley of Phoenix in the post below. As excessive heat warnings continue across the Valley, the surgeons at the Diane & Bruce Halle Arizona Burn Center encourage Arizona residents to be aware of the dangers associated with contact with hot pavement and other surfaces. ... See MoreSee Less

Do you know how to decipher when you need to go to the emergency department from when you simply need to schedule an appointment with your doctor? Choosing the right care in the right setting can save you money on healthcare costs.

However, we know this can be complicated to navigate, which is why we're here to help. Check out the article below for a few examples that can help you determine the best place to get care the next time you are experiencing a medical issue. ... See MoreSee Less

Should I go to the Emergency Room, Urgent Care, or See My Primary Care Provider? - AZ Care Network

azcarenetwork.org

Making the right decision on where to seek medical care can save money and ensure you only spend time in the emergency room when you absolutely need to.

More than 3,200 deaths from exposure to excessive natural heat have occurred in Arizona from 2012 to 2022. Keep your loved ones safe for the rest of the summer with these heat safety tips from the Arizona Department of Health Services. ☀🥵👇Before taking your dog for a walk, step outside and place your hand on the pavement. If the ground burns your hand, then it is too hot for your dog to walk on. 🚫

Learn more about heat safety tips for you and your family by visiting us online: azhealth.gov/heat ... See MoreSee Less

Check out the important tips below from Enticare that can help you protect yourself and your loved ones from noise-induced hearing loss. This type of hearing damage can come from sounds like loud music, power tools, and traffic noise. Learn more below! 🎧🔇Did you know? Noise-induced hearing loss is often preventable!

Be mindful of common sources like loud music, power tools, and traffic noise.

Protect your precious hearing by using earplugs or earmuffs when exposed to loud environments.

Your ears will thank you later! 🎧🔇

🚀 Visit our Hearing page: bit.ly/EnticareHearing to learn more! 🌐💙

#ProtectYourHearing #HearingHealth #EntiCare ... See MoreSee Less

Have you heard of Qigong? It is a physical movement and meditation exercise that can allow whole-body healing by releasing energy blockages in the body. See how our partners at St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center are using this ancient practice to bring healing to cancer patients in the post below.👇 ... See MoreSee Less

As the 100 degree Arizona heat persists through the rest of the summer, it is important to be aware of heat illness that can be life-threatening. Check out the reminder below from our partners at Abrazo Health and learn how to recognize signs of heat cramps, heat exhaustion, and heat stroke. 🥵☀👇 ... See MoreSee Less

Learn More

Signs of Heat Illness

spr.ly

Heat illness progresses from mild to serious and can be dangerous, even life-threatening.

Diabetes management can be physically, mentally and emotionally draining. Mental health can play a key role in how well someone is able to manage medications, regular A1c testing, lifestyle changes and more. Anxiety and depression are more common in people who have to manage this complex health condition.

Learn the signs of common mental health complications and what to do if they arise in you or someone you care about in the article below.👇 ... See MoreSee Less

Living with Diabetes: What to Do When Your Mental Health Feels “Off” - AZ Care Network

azcarenetwork.org

From tracking blood glucose levels to planning meals and taking care of your physical needs, managing diabetes can be physically, mentally and emotionally draining. It’s completely normal to feel sa...

Tannaz Farahani, PharmD, MPH, had a great time getting to know more about the resources Soleo Health provides for patients who elect to receive infusion therapy at home. Learn more in the video below!👇 ... See MoreSee Less

Arizona Care Network Population Health Pharmacist Tannaz Farahani, PharmD, MPH, sits down with hematology and blood disorder specialist Dr. Amit Mehta, a practicing physician in North Carolina and a clinical adjunct faculty member at Duke University.

Check out the video below to get his insights on the following topics:

🩸 Leading causes of blood clots

🔍 Critical warning signs to look out for

🩺 Treatment options available for different clots (DVT, PE, VTE) ... See MoreSee Less

Our partners at Phoenix Children's are hosting a back-to-school party for patient families of Phoenix Children’s Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) Program this Thursday from 5 to 7 pm! This free event is a great way to connect and share experiences with other kids on a similar medical journey and enjoy food and games together. Check out the post below for more information.👇 ... See MoreSee Less

IBD Patient Support Party

bit.ly

Let's come together to celebrate, connect, and support each other at the IBD Patient Support Party!

The Southwest Center for HIV/AIDS is hosting their first Stay Cool & Know Your Status event this Wednesday, July 31st. This monthly event will run from July through October to help ensure Arizona residents have a place to cool down, as well as receive no-cost HIV testing and access to health education and resources.

More details in the post below!❄️🥵👇 ... See MoreSee Less

July is #SarcomaAwarenessMonth. Sarcoma is a rare and challenging cancer that may not show symptoms in the early stages. Learn more about symptoms and treatment options for sarcoma in the link below from our partners at St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center and talk to your doctor if you have any questions or concerns about your risk level.This month we are raising awareness about a rare and challenging type of cancer. July is Sarcoma Awareness Month. Sarcoma patients may not show symptoms in the early stages, resulting in large tumors before symptoms are noticeable.

Learn more about symptoms and treatment options for sarcoma with the help of Dignity Health Cancer Institute. Visit: dignityhealth.org/arizona/services/cancer-care/cancer-types/sarcoma ... See MoreSee Less

Depression affects 16.1 million U.S. adults and anxiety affects 40 million adults every year. Almost 50 percent of people diagnosed with depression are also diagnosed with an anxiety disorder.

Learn more about common symptoms of depression and anxiety in the article below. It's important to talk to your doctor if you are experiencing these symptoms. ... See MoreSee Less

Common Symptoms of Depression and Anxiety - AZ Care Network

azcarenetwork.org

It's normal to feel anxious or sad sometimes, but when you feel down for weeks, it might be time to seek help.
